definition: to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"

sentences.english: They’re stirring up fights over a woman’s right to make her own health care choices.
sentences.chinese: 他们为妇女健康选择权益保护而搅和。

sentences.english: Not for him the rough and tumble of the financial marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 当然他也不会在金融市场里瞎搅和。

sentences.english: It seemed to be her fate to become involved with men whose presence cheapened her.
sentences.chinese: 似乎她命中注定要与那些瞧不起她的男人搅和在一起。

sentences.english: Escalating tensions have even helped rattle global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 紧张局势甚至搅和得金融市场都更加活跃。

sentences.english: You love rabble-rousing, and you love to bust systems open.
sentences.chinese: 你们爱搅和鼓动，而且你们爱打开爆裂的系统。

sentences.english: The shuffle and snicker become the comedians trademark.
sentences.chinese: 搅和与窃笑成为那个戏剧演员的标志。

sentences.english: Cauls mouldy tripes windpipes faked and minced up . puzzle find the meat.
sentences.chinese: 把胎膜发霉的肺脏以及气管剁碎，搅和在一起来冒充。

sentences.english: But there are forces mucking up the game for those who would profit most from last-mile control.
sentences.chinese: 但是有势力为了最后一英里的控制来搅和这场游戏。

sentences.english: If you are not going to help, don't help.
sentences.chinese: 你要是帮不上忙，就不要瞎搅和。

sentences.english: If you're not going to help, don't help.
sentences.chinese: 你要是帮不上忙，就不要瞎搅和。

definition: (lit.) a pot of porridge/(fig.) a complete mess
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
to mess up/to mismanage/to bungle/to confuse/to muddle
see 連鍋端|连锅端 [lian2 guo1 duan1]
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
